data.title: Various units of measurement of area.
meta_keywords: Various units of measurement of area.
data.meta_description:
Various Units of Measurement of Area 

Introduction

The most common measurements of area are explained in detail in this article for your learning purposes. The list of various units of measurement of the area that is explained in detailed in this article are given as follows:

  • One is Square Millimeter
  • Second is Square Centimeter
  • Third is Square Meter
  • Fourth is Hectare
  • And finally the fifth is Square Kilometer

History of Measurement of Units

Now, let us look at the history of the measurement of units in a brief and concise manner. During this history and the course of time, we can observe a refinement of deriving a clarity and simplicity of these units of measurement.

  • Usually, the meter, or even written as metre in some parts of the world, commonly denoted with the letter m, is defined with the measurement surface area and volume formula of the distance from the equator of the Earth to the North pole using the circumference through the Paris is put as 1/10,000,000. Now, in modern times, the same meter or metre is defined as the distance travelled by light in a vacuum over time is put 1/299,792,458.
  • The mass of a litre is usually considered for defining the kilogram (kg). This means one-thousandth of a cubic meter. It usually is defined as the mass of the platinum-iridium kilogram sample. Such a measurement is commonly maintained by the Bureau International des Poids et Mesures which is located in the Sevres, France.
  • The units of measurement of area candela is denoted by (cd) was named after the referring of the “candlepower”, historically when candles were usually the very common source of light and also for the illumination. The properties of the candles were standardized as the unit of measurement because they are the most common source of illumination and light historically and even now for some times.
  • Thus, now it can be concluded that we have learnt the commonly used units of measurement and their brief history.

Square Millimeter

First, we will look into the detailed explanation of the Square Millimeter. The square millimeter is that which is denoted as millimeter× millimeter, and this is written as mm2. The millimeter is so-called because; it is denoted for one-thousandth of a meter. And so, it is called a square millimeter. In the mathematical form, it is written as 1/1000×1/1000=1/1000, 000 of a square meter. Keeping it in other words, a square millimeter is actually a one millionth of the form of a square meter. Thus, we can say that the square meter will have 1,000,000 square millimeters.

Any field of science will definitely be involving measurements, performing an analysis on them, comprehending them, and providing them to the others related to the field for deriving conclusions. Keeping it in other words, everyone involved and related to one particular field should be discussing in the same common language, so that we will be able to discuss our thoughts and opinions. In our daily day to day life, we will be facing the need of communicating measurement units of an area the size, mass, shape, temperature, amount, power, speed, energy, amount and time.

Irrespective of the field, we are in, whether the individual is a physicist, a chemist, a medical doctor, or an engineer, or a biologist, we will definitely be facing the need of communicating these measurements we listed above to the other person in our daily day to day life.

Assume that you are a computer engineer and you are holding a screen where you are reading the units of area measurement in a particular document with a long text. Irrespective of the make of the screen, it might have been made up of liquid crystals. The chemist involved in developing such an object falls in need of communicating the requirement of the making to the other person who is related to that particular field where the requirement is there. Then that other person called engineer will fall for the need to communicate his or her requirement to the other person related to the other department.

In such manner, everyone falls for the need of communicating their requirement to the people of other field or department through same units of measurements . This is to be understood in such a manner that the engineer may fall for the need to communicate to the other engineers, chemists, scientists, physicists and doctors, to complete the making or the designing of the circuit boards, electronic interfaces or display screens, or any such. Supposing that there exists a language barrier between the people in communicating their requirements to the other departments assuming that in the various units of measurement of area, then there could be a huge void in the company and could lead to a fall in the production numbers.

In the industries including, science, industry and medicine or any other field, the metric system that is used for conveying or communicating is the International System of Units. Based on the age and geographic location of the individual, some of you might be very familiar with the system called imperial system that which includes gallons, miles, feet and pounds. This imperial system is very particularly used in communicating measurements in a very area few places around the world, which include the United States. However, the SI system is used most commonly used by many people in much parts of the world in all scientific circles.

Related Videos:

  • Volume and Capacity
  • Area and perimeters of various plane
  • Area of trapezium ABCD
  • height or altitude of the trapezium

The SI System Units

The most basic base units that are comprised area formula of in the SI system are seven, and they are listed below:

  • For mass measurements, the kilogram (kg) is used
  • And, for time measurements, the second (s) is used
  • And for temperature measurements, the kelvin (K) is used
  • And for electric current, the ampere (A) is used
  • And for the amount of a substance measurement, the mole (mol) is used
  • And for the luminous intensity measurement, the candela (cd) is used
  • And finally, for the distance measurement, the meter (m) is used.

Important Chapters:

  • NCERT Solution for Maths
  • NCERT Solution for Class 6 Maths Chapter Mensuration
  • NCERT Solution for Class 8 Maths Chapter Mensuration
